text:
I have difficulty to use Apache.
I tried to use some versions of Apache, include 2.2.17.
The first time I start apache it workds fine.
If I restart apache it gets an error and should be closed.
Then, I'm trying to start apache again and it works after I close httpd.exe.
I try to enter http://localhost/ or http://127.0.0.1, and it drops an error:

Teaching on "0x6eed568c" made ​​reference to memory in - "0x6eef4210". Memory could not be "read".

I don't have an advanced knowladge, and I used WampServer V2.0 and V2.1 to develop websites with PHP and MySQL.
The problem occurred suddenly. I don't know exactly what caused to this problem.

Thank you for your support,
Tamir
creator: tamir_gadot1@hotmail.com

text:
I try to run httpd using cmd of Windows.
The problem occurs after I try to shutdown Apache or connect to http://localhost/.
It throws an error and closes.
I tried to reinstall to service and it also doesn't help.
The port 80 is available.
When I don't use log_config_module, I'm able to connect http://localhost/ only to some pages.
There are also some pages which cause to crash and error, too.
But still, when I try to shutdown apache it throws an error and do not closed properly.
creator: tamir_gadot1@hotmail.com
tamir_gadot1@hotmail.com
text:
Created attachment 26841
An attachment that describes the error I have, when it happens for each command I try to do with httpd.

some other application is listening on port 80

take this to the user's mailing list:

http://httpd.apache.org/lists.html#http-users
creator: trawick@apache.org
